result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald Wayne Walton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald Wayne Walton

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed

Sentencing hearing held: Statements by State, Defense counsel and Defendant.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2
Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, concurrent, with 30 days credit for time served. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharges) to be paid by 8/31/2020, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court waived all WAIVABLE costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.


Court Ordered defendant to write a letter of apology.

Appellate Rights Given

 
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Donald Wayne Walton in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Donald Wayne Walton in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

AS TO COUNT 3
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the State, Court ordered count 3 DISMISSED BUT READ IN.

Attorney William Hotchkiss in court, defendant Donald Wayne Walton not in court, in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendant's appearance waived. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request.  Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2019 at 08:30 am.
